audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker engaged in a thoughtful quest for truth, referencing ancient knowledge and the Sumerians' depiction and description of the planet Nibiru. A consistent, low-level radio static is audible in the background throughout the speech.

The audio clip features a single male speaker in a neutral tone discussing early translations of a text that were inaccurate due to factors such as the planet's scale. He gives an example of an orbital period of 3,600 years in early translations being closer to 20,000 years as hypothesized by Caltech.

The clip features a single male speaker with an informative tone, detailing the Sumerian descriptions of a "failing planet" with a "burning moon" that enters the solar system regularly, causing "utter chaos" and cataclysmic events.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing the origin of the asteroid belt, suggesting it was once a planet destroyed by an ancient collision. He also talks about how Uranus is on its side, implying that a dense planetary system is influencing it. His tone is speculative and informative. He highlights the fact that this hypothetical system is influencing Uranus' moons and rings. A sound effect, potentially of an alarm or alert, then interrupts the speech.

The clip begins with a male speaker, in an informative tone, describing that for years, astronomers have looked at Uranus with amazement as they observed an unsteady orbit with a wobble. He explains that the cause must be something incredibly dense with enormous gravitational pull. This is followed by a sound which I cannot define.

The audio begins with speech, describing that a German astronomer suggested needing two planets to explain oddities in Uranus' motion, which later led to the discovery of Neptune. The speaker proceeds to mention a French astronomer claiming Neptune stumbled in its orbit, hinting that a hidden planet was causing Neptune to speed up and slow down. The speech is calm and informative. Transitioning from the speech is background music.

The clip begins with a man speaking in an informative tone, describing an anomaly involving Neptune and theorizing about "another heat source" and potentially "Nibiru having these types of effects". Another man then chuckles in response.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker, recounting how Lowell got into "the planet hunting game", and popularized the term "Planet X", with a conversational tone. There are no discernible background sounds or music.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing Planet X, mentioning calculations based on observations of Uranus and Neptune. He mentions astronomer Clyde Tombaugh, who continued Lowell's work and discovered Pluto, which was located near where Lowell had predicted Planet X to be. He then mentions anomalies relating to Uranus, such as its orbit direction, as well as its anomalous rings, citing Brian Cox's statement, "The rings of Uranus are not like any material we have ever encountered before." The speaker ends by stating that two moons orbit the rings, which may be of artificial origins. The speaker has a generally informative and serious tone. Throughout the entire clip, there's a consistent background music, with an electronic and mysterious feeling, lending a sense of cosmic wonder to the narrative.

The clip starts with a male speaker questioning, "Now get this," before presenting the official explanation of something. The speaker describes "a shepherd moon," also known as "a herd moon or a watcher moon," further explaining it as a small satellite, that "clears a gap in planetary ring material" or keeps particles contained. He mentions that the name refers to "limit[ing] the herd of the ring particles as a shepherd." The speaker questions the naturalness of this phenomenon, stating, "Does that sound like a natural occurrence to you guys?"

The audio clip features a single male speaker with a contemplative tone, discussing how evolving discoveries challenge our prior understanding of the solar system, emphasizing that previous assumptions were "inaccurate guesswork" and that "we really just don't know yet." This speech is accompanied by unobtrusive, mellow background music, creating a thoughtful atmosphere.

The clip opens with a male speaker discussing the possibility of the existence of "Nibiru," noting a lack of modern confirmation of the "elusive Planet X" and its alleged characteristics from ancient Sumerian texts. The tone is explanatory, bordering on speculative.  The speaker notes Neptune's heat source and Sumerian texts.

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the Anunnaki, suggesting they are "our creators" who came to Earth to mine gold to protect the planet from the sun. The speaker's tone is enthusiastic and informative, expressing astonishment and suggesting the claims may be true. Next, the speaker suggests that potential answers may be found in Peru.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing man-sized holes carved into the rocks and pondering who made them and why, noting that the local people do not know the origin. He suggests it looks like "a search" from remote times and mentions a possible connection to the Anunnaki mining gold. He concludes by inviting listeners to share their thoughts and thanks them for watching. Light background music plays in a calm, ambient style. There is no evident distinction of instrument. The audio ends with a short synth note.
